intro: Leucophae canariensis var. mercedesi, commonly known as the Canary Island heather, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, evergreen leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires a sunny to partially shaded location. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
